tweet:
The Trump Admin continues to pursue one of the most anti-environmental agendas in history. With the recent attack on clean air regulations, Trump & his cronies have undertaken 78 rollbacks that put our environment and public health at risk.

Unacceptable.  https://nyti.ms/2Czw3Bi
As we ring in the New Year, I hope Trump leaves his ridiculous demand for a costly, ineffective border wall back in 2018. Americans deserve better than a #TrumpShutdown. pic.twitter.com/HUVzS66s5S
We accomplished a lot in 2018—but there’s still work to be done. I’m honored to keep fighting for the people of New Jersey next year. #HappyNewYear2019 #MondayMotivation pic.twitter.com/pVomVTcicj

2018 had highs and lows, but I’m proud to say we:
👨‍🚒 Passed Firefighter Cancer Registry 
💊 Enacted leg to fight opioid crisis
🚊 Stopped Trump from killing #Gateway
💰 Won $158M for Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst 
🚫 Fought against human trafficking
👩‍⚕️ Extended #CHIP

The Trump Administration has time and again failed to efficiently address crises at the border. We need to institute major reforms to our system. https://twitter.com/axios/status/1079089514822488064 …

Our children deserve to live in a world with safe water to drink and clean air to breathe—but Trump’s rollback of pollutant protections is another direct attack on the people of New Jersey. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/28/climate/mercury-coal-pollution-regulations.html?smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytimes …

Journalists around the world faced animosity in 2018, but continued to publish critical pieces.

I’ve been working with @SenBlumenthal to pass the Journalist Protection Act—and we’ll keep fighting in 2019 to ensure that those pursuing freedom of the press are protected. https://twitter.com/HuffPost/status/1078051675800256514 …
The clock is ticking. Our children deserve to live in a world with safe water to drink and clean air to breathe. We need to preserve commonsense environmental protections for their futures.

The Trump Admin’s rollback of pollutant protections is another direct attack on the people of #NewJersey. When plants in the Midwest emit pollutants, toxins can reach states downwind, like NJ.

The effects of environmental rollbacks literally spread farther than you think. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1078713812000391168 …

New @NYTimes article underscores the harm to workers from dangerous pesticides like #chlorpyrifos due to Trump and the @EPA’s regulatory rollbacks. This is one reason why I’ve called for investigations into Trump’s chemical cronyism.

It’s a MUST READ ⬇️ https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/12/26/us/politics/donald-trump-environmental-regulation.html …

Day 7 of #TrumpShutdown: Looking to learn about our country’s history over the holidays? New Jerseyans wanting to visit Independence Hall, Liberty Bell and other national landmarks in Philadelphia are out of luck—they’re closed due to the #GovernmentShutdown. pic.twitter.com/6NAEToPqet
Good morning! Reflecting on 2018? Read this if you want to remember the more positive moments 👇 https://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/422784-6-heartwarming-moments-in-2018-politics …

Some of New Jersey’s national park sites, like Washington’s Headquarters in Morristown, have been closed to holiday visitors due to the shutdown.

NJ’s partially open parks, with limited access to staff and emergency services, pose a safety risk. https://www.nj.com/expo/news/erry-2018/12/11b0517c536951/when-the-goverment-is-on-shutd.html …

Trump Admin officials admit our border system is outdated and ill-equipped for the current stream of migrants. Agreed—but it shouldn’t take two deaths to realize we need to fix it. @SecNielsen needs to stop playing the blame game and instead institute major reforms to our system. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1078060413516947456 …

From family separation and children in cages to tragic deaths, the Trump Administration has time and again failed to efficiently address crises at the border. We need answers about the death of Felipe Alónzo-Gomez, NOT a #GovernmentShutdown over an ineffective wall.
In the Senate, we passed legislation to guarantee federal employees furloughed during the #TrumpShutdown are paid. I urge President Trump and my Republican colleagues in the House to follow suit.

Once again, our “stable genius” President is spewing lies. US federal employees serve the United States—not one party. Guaranteeing that our dedicated government workers have financial security should not be a partisan issue. #ThursdayThoughts https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1078260814157701121 …

Day 6 of #TrumpShutdown: I’ve been reading #ShutdownStories from Americans around the country. Coast Guard, TSA, federal law enforcement officers under DOJ, & hundreds of thousands of others are working without pay. Many live paycheck to paycheck—and missing one causes real harm. https://twitter.com/USATODAY/status/1077655219629101056 …

Day 5 of #TrumpShutdown: President Trump keeps holding the federal government hostage in hopes of extracting billions of taxpayer dollars from Congress for a preposterous border wall that he promised Mexico would pay for. https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/trump-government-shutdown-reopen-impact_us_5c238149e4b0407e907f1e4e …

CBP is now conducting secondary medical checks and looking for medical help from @USCG, @DeptofDefense, etc—but we can’t wait for another tragedy to happen. The Trump Admin and Border Patrol need to make serious changes and deliver a full report on what went wrong. https://twitter.com/BobMooreNews/status/1077814615936024576 …

It hasn’t even been 3 weeks and 2 children have died in #CBP custody at the border. Keeping the family of Felipe Alónzo-Gomez in my prayers. https://www.cnn.com/2018/12/25/us/guatemalan-boy-dies-in-us-custody/index.html …
Happy first day of #Kwanzaa to all who celebrate in New Jersey and around the globe! pic.twitter.com/4X6qsru1F4

My thoughts are with our service members who aren’t able to be with their loved ones this Christmas. Thank you for your dedication and service to our great nation. #MerryChristmas and Happy Holidays.🎄

It might not be a White Christmas in New Jersey this year, but I’m still in the holiday spirit! Wishing a #MerryChristmas to everyone today—filled with food, fun, family, and friends. pic.twitter.com/GBdVFGEt7u

This Christmas Eve, I’m thinking of the hundreds of thousands of federal employees at risk of losing their paychecks due to the #TrumpShutdown. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1077210291581128705 …

Wow. Days after Sec. Mattis, another top diplomat resigns in protest of Trump’s erratic decision-making that threatens US interests and Americans’ security.

We need strong diplomatic and military leadership to executive a clear strategy to protect US interests in the region. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1076521573300035584 …

Congrats—Trump wanted a #GovernmentShutdown and now he’s got it. He can celebrate all he wants, but hundreds of thousands of unpaid and furloughed federal employees will be hurting this holiday season. This shutdown could have been averted. The American people deserve better.

Trump shouldn’t treat the #GovernmentShutdown like a reality show. It has real effects on real people—like the hundreds of thousands of federal employees without paychecks before the holidays. It also affects critical services for people in #NewJersey and across the country. pic.twitter.com/UqdDopon2v

The effects of a #GovernmentShutdown spread much farther than Capitol Hill. And it’s totally avoidable. Hardworking federal employees shouldn’t be left unpaid or furloughed over Trump’s boondoggle of a border wall. pic.twitter.com/5B9q7ZgqGn

Los puertorriqueños merecen algo mejor. A #TrumpShutdown will cause real hardships for workers and families across the country—all over a costly and ineffective border wall. We should be helping our fellow Americans over the holiday season, not hurting them.

What happens if there’s a #TrumpShutdown?
❌Hundreds of thousands of federal employees won’t be paid—just days before Christmas
❌Families could be left hungry with undersupplied soup kitchens and food banks
❌Small biz & home mortgage loans will be delayed

The holidays can be hard for many Americans. With a #TrumpShutdown, hundreds of thousands of people will be left without paychecks, just before Christmas. Consequences of a shutdown spread far and wide—from federal employees & homeowners, to small biz & food assistance programs.

I joined with my colleagues last night to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the US Cadet Nurse Corps and honor its achievement. When our nation needed nurses and medical professionals during #WWII, the women of the Cadet Nurse Corps answered the call to serve our country.
